questions.prompt: Which category of design patterns deals with object creation mechanisms?
questions.explanation: Creational patterns deal with object creation mechanisms, providing flexible ways to create objects while hiding creation logic.

questions.prompt: Which category of design patterns focuses on object composition and relationships?
questions.explanation: Structural patterns deal with object composition and relationships, helping form larger structures while keeping them flexible and efficient.

questions.prompt: Which category of design patterns is concerned with algorithms and object interactions?
questions.explanation: Behavioral patterns focus on communication between objects, algorithms, and the assignment of responsibilities.

questions.prompt: The Singleton pattern belongs to which category?
questions.explanation: Singleton is a creational pattern that ensures a class has only one instance and provides a global point of access to it.

questions.prompt: The Observer pattern belongs to which category?
questions.explanation: Observer is a behavioral pattern that defines a one-to-many dependency between objects so when one changes, all its dependents are notified.

questions.prompt: What is the primary purpose of the Factory Method pattern?
options: To ensure only one instance exists
To define an interface for creating objects, letting subclasses decide which class to instantiate
To add new functionality to objects
questions.explanation: The Factory Method pattern defines an interface for creating objects but lets subclasses decide which class to instantiate, promoting loose coupling.

questions.prompt: What problem does the Singleton pattern solve?
options: Ensuring a class has exactly one instance with global access
questions.explanation: Singleton ensures a class has only one instance and provides a global access point, useful for resources like configuration managers or connection pools.

questions.prompt: What does the Adapter pattern do?
options: Converts an interface into another interface that clients expect
Adds new methods to a class
questions.explanation: The Adapter pattern converts an interface into another interface that clients expect, allowing incompatible interfaces to work together.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of the Strategy pattern?
options: To define a family of algorithms and make them interchangeable
questions.explanation: The Strategy pattern defines a family of algorithms, encapsulates each one, and makes them interchangeable, allowing the algorithm to vary independently from clients.

questions.prompt: In the Observer pattern, what is the relationship between Subject and Observers?
options: Subject notifies Observers when its state changes
questions.explanation: In Observer, the Subject maintains a list of Observers and notifies them automatically when its state changes, implementing a publish-subscribe mechanism.

questions.explanation: MVC is an architectural pattern that separates an application into Model (data), View (UI), and Controller (control logic), promoting separation of concerns.

options: A pattern that improves code quality
A common but ineffective solution that creates more problems
questions.explanation: An anti-pattern is a common response to a recurring problem that is usually ineffective and risks being counterproductive, creating more problems than it solves.

questions.prompt: The "God Object" is an example of what?
options: An anti-pattern where one class knows or does too much
questions.explanation: God Object is an anti-pattern where a single class knows about or does too much, violating the Single Responsibility Principle and making the code hard to maintain.

questions.prompt: What is the Decorator pattern used for?
options: Adding new functionality to objects dynamically without altering their structure
questions.explanation: The Decorator pattern allows adding new functionality to objects dynamically by wrapping them in decorator objects, providing a flexible alternative to subclassing.

questions.prompt: When should you use design patterns?
options: When they solve a specific problem and improve code quality
questions.explanation: Design patterns should be used when they solve a specific problem and genuinely improve code quality. Overuse can lead to unnecessary complexity.
